title: (x) Vyron Corporation logo - Ibsen (slanted) {Mark S}
content:
Anyone like to take a stab at this one, I’ve seen it before but cannot remember where.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Vyron.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Vyron.jpg) | 8.73 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
Looks like someone obliqued House Gothic 23 Condensed Bold-1

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=15&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20051219063753/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=15&subpage=viewfonts)
Nice try, but not quite - there are many subtle differences.
How old is the logo, Evan? It may be that it was created by older non-digital type by which House Gothic is inspired.

Not sure, but here is the website…  
 [http://www.vyron.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051219063753/http:/www.vyron.com/)

Says since 1955, so maybe this was created sometime ago. It appears to be like Compacta, but that’s not correct either.
It appears to be an old film font called Isben which has been slanted. (On page 155 in the Solotype Catalog.)
Hmm thanks. Can I order a solotype catalog?
